column4: hi everyone, i've a bit of a question regarding swaping files between windows and linux

i have a usb memory stick that i use to lug my website around so i can work on it at work, and it works great :D but only problem is when i bring the files back home, they lose all file permissions they once had and only keep "owner" permissions.  so i have to manually set permissions again before my files will work in linux. my memory stick uses FAT32, any way around that?
will windows 2000 be able to read ext2 natively?
